## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi, I'm playing around with the `getidentitycontent` command and I was wondering, what is the default value of the `heightend` argument?

**AI Assistant:**
The default value of the `heightend` argument in the `getidentitycontent` command is not `-1`, but rather `0`, which means it will return content up to the current maximum height. If you want to include values from the mempool, you need to set `heightend` to `-1`.

**User:**
That's really helpful, thanks! I was also wondering, does the `getidentitycontent` command always return deleted items in its result?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the `getidentitycontent` command does not always return deleted items in its result. By default, it does not return deleted items. You need to set the `keepdeleted` argument to `true` to include deleted items in the result.
What is the default value of the `heightend` argument in the `getidentitycontent` command?

The default value of the `heightend` argument in the `getidentitycontent` command is not `-1`, but rather `0`, which means it will return content up to the current maximum height. If you want to include values from the mempool, you need to set `heightend` to `-1`.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof
  "vdxfkey"              (vdxf key, optional) default=null, more selective search for specific content in ID
  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentitycontent "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitycontent", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Does the `getidentitycontent` command always return deleted items in its result?

No, the `getidentitycontent` command does not always return deleted items in its result. By default, it does not return deleted items. You need to set the `keepdeleted` argument to `true` to include deleted items in the result.

getidentitycontent "name@ || iid" (heightstart) (heightend) (txproofs) (txproofheight) (vdxfkey) (keepdeleted)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "heightstart"            (number, optional) default=0, only return content from this height forward, inclusive
  "heightend"             (number, optional) default=0 which means max height, only return content up to this height,
                                inclusive. -1 means also return values from the mempool.
  "txproofs"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof
  "vdxfkey"              (vdxf key, optional) default=null, more selective search for specific content in ID
  "keepdeleted"            (bool, optional) default=false, if true, return deleted items as well

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentitycontent "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitycontent", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
